triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed by policy for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider requesting a higher deposit or reducing the loan amount to meet the LTV requirement.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum LTV for Tier A is 90%. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 91.11%, which exceeds the limit.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowed by policy for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to lower the DTI ratio.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 40% for Tier A applicants. The calculated DTI for this proposal is 41.25%, which is above the threshold.

content.reasoning: The proposal was analyzed against the underwriting policy. The applicant's credit score qualifies for Tier A, which allows for a maximum Loan-to-Value (LTV) of 90% and a Debt-to-Income (DTI) ratio of 40%. However, the proposal's LTV is 91.11%, exceeding the policy limit, and the DTI is 41.25%, also above the allowed threshold. These findings indicate a medium risk level due to the policy violations.
